name: Food Standards Australia New Zealand Act 1991
description: This Act may be cited as the Food Standards Australia New Zealand Act 1991.

name: Commencement
description: This section of the Act specifies the commencement date of the Act, which is subject to proclamation or a set time period after Royal Assent.

name: Food Standards Australia New Zealand
description: A joint body established to ensure a high standard of public health protection throughout Australia and New Zealand.

name: Consumer Confidence
description: A high degree of consumer confidence in the quality and safety of food produced, processed, sold or exported from Australia and New Zealand.

name: Regulatory Framework
description: An effective, transparent and accountable regulatory framework within which the food industry can work efficiently.

name: Consumer Information
description: The provision of adequate information relating to food to enable consumers to make informed choices.

name: Common Rules
description: The establishment of common rules for both countries and the promotion of consistency between domestic and international food regulatory measures without reducing the safeguards applying to public health and consumer protection.

name: Agricultural and Veterinary Chemicals Code
description: The Code set out in the Schedule to the Agricultural and Veterinary Chemicals Code Act 1994 of the Commonwealth.

name: Appropriate Government Agency
description: An entity that is either a relevant Department of State administered by a Minister who is a member of the Forum on Food Regulation, a body with an officer on the Food Regulation Standing Committee, or any other body or officer that the Authority considers has a particular interest in the relevant matter.

name: Australian Pesticides and Veterinary Medicines Authority
description: The authority continued in existence by section 6 of the Agricultural and Veterinary Chemicals (Administration) Act 1992.

name: Australia New Zealand Food Standards Code
description: The code published under the name Food Standards Code on 27 August 1987 with any amendments approved by a former Council before the Act commenced or made under this Act.

name: Australia New Zealand Joint Food Standards Agreement
description: The Agreement between the Government of Australia and the Government of New Zealand Establishing a System for the Development of Joint Food Standards, signed on 5 December 1995, as amended.

name: Food Standards Australia New Zealand
description: The organization referred to as Food Standards Australia New Zealand.

name: Board of the Authority
description: The Board of Food Standards Australia New Zealand.

name: Chief Officer
description: The person responsible for the Executive Officer or Chief Executive Officer role of a Commonwealth, State, Territory or New Zealand authority, or the person responsible for the day to day management of any other authority or body.

name: Code of Practice
description: A code of practice developed by the Authority under Part 3, which is not a standard.

name: Commonwealth Authority
description: A body established by the Commonwealth, or by or under a law of the Commonwealth.

name: Confidential Commercial Information
description: Information relating to food that is a trade secret or has commercial value that would be destroyed or diminished if disclosed.

name: Minister administering the Public Governance, Performance and Accountability Act 2013
description: The Minister responsible for administering the Public Governance, Performance and Accountability Act 2013.

name: Food
description: As defined by section 5 of the Act.

name: Food Regulation Agreement
description: The agreement between the Commonwealth, the States, the Northern Territory, and the Australian Capital Territory, first made on 3 November 2000 or any substitution for that agreement.

name: Food Regulation Standing Committee
description: The Committee established under the Food Regulation Agreement.

name: Food Regulatory Measure
description: A standard or a code of practice.

name: Former Council
description: The Council of Commonwealth, State and Territory Ministers known as the National Food Standards Council or its reconstituted forms.

name: Forum on Food Regulation
description: The Australia and New Zealand Ministerial Forum on Food Regulation established by the Food Regulation Agreement.

name: High Level Health Claims Committee
description: A committee established to give advice on applications or proposals to make a high level health claims variation.

name: High Level Health Claims Variation
description: A variation that changes the list of high level health claims that may be made under the Nutrition, Health and Related Claims Standard.

name: Maximum Residue Limits Standard
description: The Maximum Residue Limits Standard as in force from time to time, or any standard in force in substitution for that standard.

name: Member of the Board
description: A member of the Board of the Authority, including the Chairperson and the Chief Executive Officer.

name: New Zealand Authority
description: A body established by New Zealand, or by or under a law of New Zealand.

name: New Zealand Lead Minister on the Forum on Food Regulation
description: The Minister of the government of New Zealand who is a member of the Forum on Food Regulation and nominated to be the lead Minister.

name: Nutrition, Health and Related Claims Standard
description: The Nutrition, Health and Related Claims Standard as in force from time to time, or any standard in force in substitution for that standard.

name: Policy Guideline
description: A guideline formulated by the Forum on Food Regulation for the purposes of paragraph 18(2)(e).

name: Standard
description: A standard made under this Act after the commencement of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Australia New Zealand Food Authority Amendment Act 2001, a standard adopted by a former Council under this Act, or a standard included in the Australia New Zealand Food Standards Code, excluding editorial notes and examples.

name: State or Territory Authority
description: A body established by a State or Territory, or by or under a law of a State or Territory.

name: Territory
description: Refers to the Australian Capital Territory and the Northern Territory.

name: Trust Money
description: Money received or held by the Authority on trust.

name: Therapeutic Good
description: A therapeutic good within the meaning of the Therapeutic Goods Act 1989.

name: Live Animals and Plants
description: Live animals and plants may be included as food.

name: Minister
description: The Minister is authorized to declare a substance or thing as food for the purposes of the Act after consulting the Authority.

name: Legislation Act 2003
description: Legislation that contains provisions about disallowance and sunsetting that do not apply to the declaration made by the Minister under the FOOD STANDARDS AUSTRALIA NEW ZEALAND ACT 1991.

name: New Zealand Gazette
description: The publication in which the Minister must cause a copy of the declaration to be published.

name: Declaration of what is food
description: A legislative instrument by which the Minister declares a substance or thing as food for the purposes of the Act.

name: Public Notice Requirements
description: Requirements for the Authority to give public notice of a particular matter under the Act.

name: Appropriate Government Agency
description: Government agencies that must be given written notice by the Authority when public notice is required.

name: Applicant
description: Individual or entity applying to develop or vary a food regulatory measure.

name: Submission Contributor
description: Persons invited to make a submission and who made a submission within the relevant period.

name: Other Person or Body
description: Any other person or body considered appropriate by the Authority to receive written notice.

name: Exclusive Capturable Commercial Benefit
description: A benefit conferred upon a person or body who applies for the development or variation of a food regulatory measure under section 22, characterized by potential financial gain from the effect of the draft standard or variation and the requirement for others to have the applicant's agreement to financially benefit from the application.

name: Section 22
description: The section of the FOOD STANDARDS AUSTRALIA NEW ZEALAND ACT 1991 under which a person or body can apply for the development or variation of a food regulatory measure.

name: Food Regulatory Measure
description: A measure related to the regulation of food standards, the development or variation of which can be applied for under section 22.

name: Draft Standard or Variation
description: The draft version of a standard or its variation that is prepared in relation to an application under section 22.

name: Unrelated Persons or Bodies
description: Persons or commercial entities that are not related to the applicant and would require the applicant's agreement to benefit financially from the approval of the application.

name: Corporation
description: Any corporation to which paragraph 51(xx) of the Constitution is applicable.

name: Trading Corporation
description: A trading corporation to which paragraph 51(xx) of the Constitution is applicable.

name: Food Standard
description: The standard of food sold by corporations or standards in relation to activities undertaken by corporations in respect of food before, or in connection with, its sale.

name: Trade and Commerce
description: Ensuring that trade and commerce in food between Australia and places outside Australia or among the States is carried on in an efficient and profitable manner.

name: Territories Regulation
description: Regulation of food and food standards in the Territories.

name: Commonwealth Standards Control
description: Controlling the standards of all food supplied to the Commonwealth, its authorities and its instrumentalities.

name: Weights and Measures
description: Fixing of weights and measures in respect of food.

name: Crown
description: The Crown in right of the Commonwealth, of each of the States, of the Australian Capital Territory and of the Northern Territory

name: Chapter 2 of the Criminal Code
description: Sets out the general principles of criminal responsibility.

name: FOOD STANDARDS AUSTRALIA NEW ZEALAND ACT 1991
description: The act to which Chapter 2 of the Criminal Code applies.

name: Australia New Zealand Food Authority
description: The body that was known as the Australia New Zealand Food Authority before being continued as Food Standards Australia New Zealand.

name: Acts Interpretation Act 1901
description: An act that includes provisions relevant to the continuation of the Australia New Zealand Food Authority as Food Standards Australia New Zealand.

name: Public Governance, Performance and Accountability Act 2013
description: An act that applies to the Authority, dealing with matters relating to corporate Commonwealth entities, including reporting and the use and management of public resources.

name: Australia New Zealand Food Standards Code
description: A code that contains the standards and guidelines for food safety and labeling in Australia and New Zealand.

name: Minister
description: The Minister responsible for administering Part 3-3 of Schedule 2 to the Competition and Consumer Act 2010, which relates to the recall of food under Commonwealth law.

name: States and Territories
description: The state and territory governments in Australia that work in consultation with the Authority on various functions related to food standards and safety.

name: New Zealand
description: A country that can request the Authority to perform functions similar to those it performs for the States and Territories of Australia.

name: Forum on Food Regulation
description: The Minister must consult with the Forum on Food Regulation before giving a direction under subsection (1).

name: Public Governance, Performance and Accountability Act 2013
description: Section 22 of this Act deals with the application of government policy to corporate Commonwealth entities and its application is not affected by this section.

name: Handling of Food
description: Includes produce, collect, receive, store, serve, display, package, transport, dispose of or recall food.

name: Composition of Food
description: Standards related to the composition of food, including contaminants, additives, microbiological status, and methods of sampling and testing.

name: Production of Food
description: Standards related to the production of food.

name: Handling of Food
description: Standards related to the handling of food.

name: Prohibition of the Sale of Food
description: Standards related to the prohibition of the sale of food in all or specified circumstances, unconditionally or subject to specified conditions.

name: Information about Food
description: Standards related to information about food including labelling, promotion, and advertising.

name: Requirements for People Handling Food
description: Standards related to the knowledge, skill, health, and hygiene requirements for people handling food.

name: Responsibilities of Businesses Handling Food
description: Standards related to the responsibilities of businesses handling food, including hygiene requirements and confidentiality of information.

name: Use of Devices to Measure Food Temperature
description: Standards related to the use of devices of a particular standard to measure the temperature of food.

name: Premises for Handling Food
description: Standards related to the design, construction, maintenance, and cleanliness of premises, equipment, and vehicles used for handling food.

name: Information from Food Businesses
description: Standards related to the information that a business handling food may be required to give about the business to State or Territory authorities.

name: Restrictions on Food Sale
description: Standards related to restrictions on the premises at which, and the persons by whom, particular food may be sold or otherwise supplied.

name: Restrictions on Food Advertisements
description: Standards related to restrictions on the publications that may contain advertisements for particular food.

name: Requirements Relating to Animals and Pests
description: Standards related to requirements for animals and pests at premises in which food is handled, or in vehicles in which food is transported.

name: Interpretation of Standards
description: Standards related to the interpretation of other standards.

name: Application of Standards
description: Standards related to the application of standards.

name: Public Health Matters Relating to Food
description: Standards related to other public health matters relating to food as prescribed.

name: Class of Food
description: Standards may relate to a class of food generally.

name: Particular Brand of Food
description: Standards may relate to a particular brand of food.

name: Codes of practice
description: Codes of practice, and variations of codes of practice, may deal only with matters that may be included in standards.

name: Protection of public health and safety
description: The highest priority objective of the Authority in developing or reviewing food regulatory measures.

name: Provision of adequate information to consumers
description: Objective to enable consumers to make informed choices regarding food.

name: Prevention of misleading or deceptive conduct
description: Objective to prevent misleading or deceptive conduct in food regulation.

name: Risk analysis based on scientific evidence
description: The need for standards to be based on risk analysis using the best available scientific evidence.

name: Consistency between domestic and international food standards
description: Promotion of consistency between domestic and international food standards.

name: Efficient and internationally competitive food industry
description: The desirability of an efficient and internationally competitive food industry.

name: Fair trading in food
description: The promotion of fair trading in food.

name: Policy guidelines by the Forum on Food Regulation
description: Guidelines formulated by the Forum on Food Regulation for the Authority to consider in developing or reviewing food regulatory measures.

name: Sanitary or phytosanitary measures
description: Measures applied to protect life and health of animals, plants, and humans from risks arising from pests, diseases, and contaminants in food and to prevent damage from pests.

name: Three Year Forward Plan
description: A plan that outlines the Authority's intentions to develop standards or variations to standards for the next three years.

name: Application for food regulatory measure
description: A request made for the development or variation of a food regulatory measure, excluding high level health claims variations.

name: Public Submissions
description: A process where the Authority calls for public input on the application or draft food regulatory measure.

name: Draft Food Regulatory Measure
description: A preliminary version of a food regulatory measure prepared by the Authority.

name: Application Requirements
description: Requirements for an application to develop or vary a food regulatory measure, including being in writing, following a specified form, including all necessary information and things, and identifying the applicable procedure.

name: Guidelines under Section 23
description: Guidelines that specify the form, information, and things to be included with an application for the development or variation of a food regulatory measure.

name: Application Guidelines
description: Guidelines specifying the form, information, and things to be included with applications for the development or variation of food regulatory measures.

name: Section 146
description: A section of the Act that may involve a charge payable to the Authority in relation to applications for food regulatory measures.

name: Section 28
description: A section of the Food Standards Australia New Zealand Act 1991 that involves giving public notice of an application.

name: Section 51
description: A section of the Food Standards Australia New Zealand Act 1991 that involves giving public notice of an application.

name: General Procedure
description: The default procedure adopted by the Authority for considering applications for the development or variation of food regulatory measures.

name: Subdivision E
description: Subdivision E applies to applications for a minor variation of a food regulatory measure.

name: Subdivision F
description: Subdivision F applies to applications for the development of a new food regulatory measure or a major variation of a food regulatory measure.

name: Subdivision G
description: Subdivision G applies to applications for a high level health claims variation.

name: Urgent Application
description: An application declared to be urgent for the purposes of this Part under section 95.

name: High Level Health Claims Variation
description: A variation that involves high level health claims.

name: Other Kind of Variation
description: A variation of a kind other than a high level health claims variation.

name: Subsection 22(2) compliance
description: A criterion that applications must comply with for the Authority to consider accepting them.

name: Previous application or proposal
description: A past application or proposal that new applications are compared to in order to determine if they are too similar and should be rejected.

name: Charge under Section 146
description: A charge that must be paid by the applicant in relation to the application, which can be payable in instalments.

name: Public notice of application
description: A notice given by the Authority to the public stating the receipt and acceptance of an application for a food regulatory measure, along with other relevant details.

name: New Zealand Standards
description: Standards relevant to the assessment of applications by the Authority.

name: Section 18 of the FOOD STANDARDS AUSTRALIA NEW ZEALAND ACT 1991
description: A section that sets out the objectives of the Authority in developing food regulatory measures and variations of those measures.

name: Public Notice under Section 31
description: A notice to the public that is required by Section 31 of the Food Standards Australia New Zealand Act 1991.

name: Draft Variation of Food Regulatory Measure
description: A draft variation to an existing food regulatory measure prepared by the Authority.

name: Written Submissions
description: Submissions from the public for the Authority's consideration of the draft measure or draft variation.

name: Submission Period
description: The time period specified in the public notice during which written submissions must be given to the Authority.

name: Standard Development or Variation
description: The process undertaken by the Authority when an application results in the development or variation of a standard.

name: Code of Practice Development or Variation
description: The process undertaken by the Authority when an application results in the development or variation of a code of practice.

name: Section 33
description: A section of the Food Standards Australia New Zealand Act 1991 that outlines steps to be followed for standard development or variation.

name: Section 34
description: A section of the Food Standards Australia New Zealand Act 1991 that outlines additional steps to be followed for standard development or variation.

name: Section 35
description: A section of the Food Standards Australia New Zealand Act 1991 that outlines steps to be followed for code of practice development or variation.

name: Draft Standard or Draft Variation
description: A proposed standard or variation to an existing standard that is subject to approval, amendment, or rejection by the Authority.

name: Report under Section 33
description: A report prepared by the Authority that includes reasons for decisions, summaries of assessments and submissions, responses to issues raised, and copies of the draft standard or draft variation.

name: Regulation Impact Statement
description: A statement that may be included in the report if applicable, providing impact analysis of the regulation.

name: Division 3
description: The section of the legislation that outlines the process followed by the Forum on Food Regulation after receiving notification from the Authority.

name: Application of Subdivision
description: This Subdivision applies to an application for the variation of a food regulatory measure that does not impose, vary, or remove obligations or rights, or otherwise alter the legal effect of the measure.

name: Variation of Food Regulatory Measure
description: A variation of a food regulatory measure that corrects typographical errors, updates references to other documents, changes cross-references within a measure, or omits provisions that have ceased to have effect.

name: Modifications in Subdivision
description: Modifications to the general procedure that the Authority must adopt when considering an application.

name: FOOD STANDARDS AUSTRALIA NEW ZEALAND ACT 1991 - SECT 38
description: Modification of step set out in section 29

name: section 29
description: Section of the FOOD STANDARDS AUSTRALIA NEW ZEALAND ACT 1991 which includes steps that the Authority must follow

name: paragraphs 29(2)(a) and (b)
description: Require the Authority to do a cost benefit analysis

name: Section 30 of FOOD STANDARDS AUSTRALIA NEW ZEALAND ACT 1991
description: Section 30 deals with the case where the draft variation differs from that sought in the application, or was not sought at all.

name: Section 39 of FOOD STANDARDS AUSTRALIA NEW ZEALAND ACT 1991
description: Section 39 modifies the step set out in Section 30 by stating that subsections 30(2) and (3) do not apply.

name: Section 31
description: A step set out in the FOOD STANDARDS AUSTRALIA NEW ZEALAND ACT 1991 which is modified by section 40.

name: Section 40
description: Modifies the step set out in section 31, stating that section 31 does not apply, and outlines the process the Authority must follow after preparing a draft variation of the food regulatory measure as a result of an application.

name: Draft Variation
description: A draft variation of a food regulatory measure prepared by the Authority as a result of an application.

name: Report under Section 41
description: A report prepared by the Authority that includes reasons for accepting the application, a summary of the assessment, reasons for the decision on the draft variation, and a copy of the draft variation.

name: Development of a new food regulatory measure
description: An application process for creating new regulations pertaining to food standards.

name: Variation of a food regulatory measure
description: An application process for modifying existing regulations pertaining to food standards.

name: Scientific or technical complexity
description: A condition where the application involves complexity that necessitates a specific procedure for consideration.

name: Significant change to the scope
description: A condition where the application involves a significant change to the scope of the food regulatory measure that necessitates a specific procedure for consideration.

name: Section 44
description: A section of the Food Standards Australia New Zealand Act 1991 that requires the Authority to give public notice after assessing an application under section 29 but before undertaking the step set out in section 30.

name: Nutrition, Health and Related Claims Standard
description: A standard under the FOOD STANDARDS AUSTRALIA NEW ZEALAND ACT 1991 that regulates the claims that can be made about the nutrition and health benefits of food.

name: Charge under Section 146
description: A charge that the applicant must pay in relation to the application, which may be payable in instalments.

name: High Level Health Claims Committee
description: A committee established for the purpose of making recommendations on applications for high level health claims variations.

name: Food Regulation Standing Committee
description: A committee to which the Authority must give notice of applications for high level health claims variations.

name: Draft High Level Health Claims Variation
description: A proposed change to food standards that the Authority must consider for approval.

name: Public Notice under Section 51
description: A procedure where the Authority gives public notice calling for submissions to consider for assessing a draft variation.

name: High Level Health Claims Variation
description: A draft variation related to high level health claims that the Authority must consider for approval or rejection.

name: Section 51 Notice
description: A notice calling for submissions under section 51 of the Act, which is part of the process for considering a draft high level health claims variation.

name: Section 150
description: A section of the Act that specifies the Board must not delegate its powers to act on behalf of the Authority in approving or rejecting draft high level health claims variations.

name: Report Prepared Under Section 52
description: A report that the Authority must provide to the Forum on Food Regulation upon approval of a draft high level health claims variation.

name: Submissions Called for Under Section 51
description: A procedure where submissions are called for, which if done, requires the Authority to give public notice of the decision.

name: Draft Standard
description: A draft version of a standard that the Authority must decide to approve or reject.

name: Draft Code of Practice
description: A draft version of a code of practice that the Authority must decide to revoke or vary.

name: Proposal for food regulatory measure
description: A written document prepared by the Authority for the development or variation of a food regulatory measure.

name: Proposal
description: A proposal that may result in the development or variation of a standard or code of practice.

name: Public Notice under Section 58 or 75
description: A public notice that is given under section 58 or 75 of the Act.

name: Abandonment Notice
description: A notice stating that the Authority has decided to abandon the proposal and how to obtain further information about the decision and the reasons for it.

name: Minor Variation of a Food Regulatory Measure
description: A type of proposal to which Subdivision E applies, indicating a different procedure from the general procedure.

name: Development of a New or Major Variation of a Food Regulatory Measure
description: A type of proposal to which Subdivision F applies, indicating a different procedure from the general procedure.

name: High Level Health Claims Variation
description: A type of proposal to which Subdivision G applies, indicating a different procedure from the general procedure.

name: Urgent Proposal
description: A proposal declared to be urgent for the purposes of this Part under section 95, indicating a different procedure from the general procedure.

name: Public Notice of Proposal
description: A notice given by the Authority to the public stating the preparation of a proposal, its date, summary, procedure to be adopted, key steps timeline, and how to obtain further information.

name: Section 56
description: A section of the Act that allows the Authority to abandon a proposal.

name: Standard Development or Variation
description: The process of developing or varying a standard which the Authority must follow according to sections 63 and 64.

name: Code of Practice Development or Variation
description: The process of developing or varying a code of practice which the Authority must follow according to section 65.

name: Section 63
description: A step that the Authority must follow for standard development or variation.

name: Section 64
description: A step that the Authority must follow for standard development or variation.

name: Section 65
description: A step that the Authority must follow for code of practice development or variation.

name: Correction of Typographical Error
description: An example of a variation that corrects a typographical error within a food regulatory measure.

name: Update of Reference
description: An example of a variation that updates a reference to another document within a food regulatory measure.

name: Change of Cross-Reference
description: An example of a variation that changes a cross-reference within a food regulatory measure.

name: Omission of Ceased Provisions
description: An example of a variation that omits provisions of a food regulatory measure that have ceased to have effect.

name: Section 61
description: A step set out in the FOOD STANDARDS AUSTRALIA NEW ZEALAND ACT 1991 which is modified by Section 68.

name: Draft Variation of a Food Regulatory Measure
description: A draft variation prepared by the Authority as a result of a proposal.

name: Appropriate Government Agencies
description: Government agencies to which the Authority must give written notice after preparing a draft variation of the food regulatory measure.

name: Written Submissions
description: Submissions called for by the Authority for the purpose of consideration of the draft variation, to be made within a specified period.

name: Report under Section 69
description: A report prepared by the Authority that includes reasons for preparing the proposal, a summary of assessment results, reasons for approving or rejecting the draft variation, and a copy of the draft variation.

name: Modifications
description: Specific changes to the general procedure that must be adopted by the Authority when considering the proposal.

name: Section 59 of the Food Standards Australia New Zealand Act 1991
description: A section of the Act that outlines a step that the Authority must take in assessing a proposal.

name: Section 60 of the Food Standards Australia New Zealand Act 1991
description: A section of the Act that outlines the step following the assessment of a proposal by the Authority.

name: Subdivision of SECT 74
description: This Subdivision outlines the application of SECT 74 to proposals for the variation of the Nutrition, Health and Related Claims Standard, specifically when the variation proposed is a high level health claims variation.

name: Protection of Public Health and Safety
description: An objective that the Authority must be satisfied is met before approving the draft variation.

name: Provision of Adequate Information Relating to Food
description: An objective to enable consumers to make informed choices, which the Authority must consider before approving the draft variation.

name: Prevention of Misleading or Deceptive Conduct
description: An objective to prevent misleading or deceptive conduct in relation to food, which the Authority must consider before approving the draft variation.

name: submission period
description: The specified period within which written submissions must be given to the Authority for the purpose of considering the draft variation.

name: Report Prepared Under Section 78
description: A report that the Authority prepares under section 78, which must be provided to the Forum on Food Regulation upon approval of a draft high level health claims variation.

name: Application of Division
description: This Division applies if the APVMA notifies the Authority under section 8E of the Agvet Code of an application or variation in relation to a chemical product.

name: Section 8E of the Agvet Code
description: Section 8E of the Agvet Code is the regulation under which the APVMA notifies the Authority of an application or variation in relation to a chemical product.

name: APVMA Notification
description: A notification under section 8E of the Agvet Code regarding an application or variation.

name: Maximum Residue Limits Standard
description: A standard that specifies the permitted maximum residue limits for chemical products.

name: Legislative Instrument
description: A variation made under subsection (1) is considered a legislative instrument.

name: Gazette
description: The publication in which a copy of the variation must be published.

name: Food Regulation Agreement
description: A document that the Forum on Food Regulation must comply with when exercising its powers in relation to a draft standard or variation.

name: Australia New Zealand Joint Food Standards Agreement
description: A document that the Forum on Food Regulation must comply with when exercising its powers in relation to a draft high level health claims variation.

name: Section 92
description: Contains the publication requirements that the Authority must comply with when the Forum on Food Regulation does not intend to request a review.

name: Direction under subsection (2)
description: A direction given by the Forum on Food Regulation to the Authority in relation to the conduct of a review, which is not a legislative instrument.

name: Review of Draft Standard or Variation
description: A process conducted by the Authority upon request by the Forum on Food Regulation, subject to any directions under subsection 86(2).

name: Decision by Authority
description: The event where the Authority decides to either re-affirm approval of the draft, re-affirm approval with necessary amendments, or withdraw approval of the draft.

name: Notification to Forum
description: The event where the Authority notifies the Forum on Food Regulation of its decision and reasons within 10 business days.

name: Publication Requirements Section 92
description: The requirements that the Authority must comply with regarding the publication of a draft standard or draft variation when the Forum on Food Regulation does not intend to amend or reject it.

name: New Zealand Gazette
description: A publication where the Authority must publish a copy of the notice regarding the draft or amended draft of food standards.

name: Authority's website
description: The online platform where the Authority must publish a copy of the notice and the text of the draft or the amended draft of food standards.

name: Standard or Variation
description: A regulation or amendment to a regulation under the FOOD STANDARDS AUSTRALIA NEW ZEALAND ACT 1991.

name: Notice under Section 92
description: A notice given under section 92 of the FOOD STANDARDS AUSTRALIA NEW ZEALAND ACT 1991 that specifies the day a standard or variation takes effect.

name: Standards and variations are legislative instruments
description: A standard, or a variation of a standard, in relation to which a notice is published under section 92 is a legislative instrument.

name: Disallowance
description: Section 42 of the Legislation Act 2003, which pertains to disallowance, does not apply to the standard or variation.

name: Exemption from disallowance
description: Subsection 44(1) of the Legislation Act 2003 provides that disallowance under Section 42 does not apply to the standard or variation.

name: Exemption from sunsetting
description: Subsection 54(1) of the Legislation Act 2003 provides that sunsetting under Part 4 of Chapter 3 does not apply to the standard or variation.

name: Sunsetting
description: Part 4 of Chapter 3 of the Legislation Act 2003, which pertains to sunsetting of legislative instruments, does not apply to the standard or variation.

name: Negative Impact on Trade
description: A situation where a standard has had or will have an unintended negative impact on trade, which can be a reason for the Authority to declare an application or proposal as urgent.

name: Appropriate Government Agency
description: Government agencies that must be given a copy of the declaration when an application or proposal is declared urgent by the Authority.

name: Public Notice of Declaration
description: A notice that the Authority must give to announce a declaration of an urgent application or proposal, including a copy of the declaration.

name: Media Publicity
description: The process of distributing copies of the urgent declaration to print and electronic media in Australia and New Zealand to inform the public.

name: Exemptions for Urgent Application or Proposal
description: Certain subdivisions and divisions of the Act that do not apply to an urgent application or proposal.

name: No Charge for Urgent Application
description: No fee is required under section 146 for processing an urgent application.

name: Public Notice of Approval
description: A notice given by the Authority to inform the public about the approval of a draft standard or variation and where to obtain further information.

name: Legislative Instrument
description: The form that a standard or variation takes once it is approved and notice is published under subsection 4.

name: Subdivision
description: The Subdivision referenced applies under certain conditions.

name: Section 97
description: The section under which the Authority approves a draft standard or a draft variation of a standard.

name: Costs and Benefits
description: The costs and benefits to the community, Government, or industry from the standard or variation.

name: Alternative Measures
description: Other measures that could be more cost-effective than the standard or variation.

name: Other Relevant Matters
description: Any other matters that are relevant to the assessment of the standard or variation.

name: subsection 103(2)
description: A legislative provision that may give directions on how the Authority should conduct reviews.

name: section 55
description: A legislative provision under which the Authority can prepare a proposal for the development of a variation or a replacement standard.

name: section 150
description: A legislative provision stating that the Board must not delegate its powers to act on behalf of the Authority under subsection (2).

name: Public Notice of Application
description: A notice given to the public under section 28 or 51 regarding an application.

name: Withdrawn Application
description: An application is considered withdrawn if the applicant fails to comply with the Authority's request for further information without a reasonable excuse.

name: Consideration Period
description: The time frame within which the Authority must complete the consideration of applications for standards or variations.

name: Expedited Consideration
description: An election by the applicant to have the consideration of their application expedited.

name: Assessment of Application
description: The process undertaken by the Authority when it begins its assessment of the application under section 29.

name: Extension of Consideration Period
description: A procedure where the Authority may extend the consideration period if it is not practicable to complete the general procedure within the specified period.

name: Stopping the Clock
description: A procedure where the consideration period is paused for certain events, such as the applicant providing further information, unpaid charges, or an application for review by the Administrative Appeals Tribunal.

name: Suspension of Consideration
description: A procedure where the Authority may suspend its consideration of any application which would be affected by policy guidelines once formulated.

name: Section 58
description: A section of the Act that requires public notice by the Authority under certain conditions.

name: Section 75
description: A section of the Act that requires public notice by the Authority under certain conditions.

name: Public Hearing
description: A hearing that may be conducted by the Authority at any point during the consideration of an application or proposal for the development or variation of a food regulatory measure, excluding applications for a high level health claims variation.

name: Private Part of Hearing
description: A part of the public hearing that the Authority may direct to be held in private due to the confidential nature of evidence or any other reason.

name: Direction Prohibiting or Restricting Publication
description: A directive that the Authority may issue to prohibit or restrict the publication of evidence or documents produced during public or private hearings or the review or assessment of draft food regulatory measures or variations.

name: Section 55
description: Section of the Act related to proposals that the Authority may decide not to act upon to avoid duplication of work.

name: Board member
description: A person who is a member of the Board of the Authority.

name: Staff member of the Authority
description: A person who is a member of the staff of the Authority.

name: Committee member
description: A person who is a member of a committee.

name: Consultant
description: A person engaged as a consultant under section 136.

name: Chief Executive Officer
description: The Chief Executive Officer of the Authority.

name: Prescribed authority or person
description: An authority or person to whom confidential information may be disclosed as prescribed.

name: Applicant
description: A person or body who applies for the development or variation of a food regulatory measure.

name: Agency Head
description: The head of an Agency within the meaning of the Public Service Act 1999.

name: Chief Officer of a Commonwealth authority
description: The Chief Officer of a Commonwealth authority.

name: Secretary of a Department of the Public Service of a State or Territory
description: The Secretary of a Department of the Public Service of a State or Territory.

name: Chief Officer of a State or Territory authority
description: The Chief Officer of a State or Territory authority.

name: Chief executive of a Department of State of New Zealand
description: The chief executive of a Department of State of New Zealand.

name: Chief Officer of a New Zealand authority
description: The Chief Officer of a New Zealand authority.

name: Chief Officer of any other authority or body
description: The Chief Officer of any other authority or body.

name: Court
description: Includes a tribunal, authority or person having power to require the production of documents or the answering of questions.

name: Board of Food Standards Australia New Zealand
description: The organization responsible for conducting the affairs of the Authority.

name: Chairperson of the Board
description: The Chairperson is a part-time member of the Board who must be appointed by the Minister and is subject to the agreement of the Forum on Food Regulation.

name: New Zealand lead Minister on the Forum on Food Regulation
description: This Minister nominates members to the Board for specific roles.

name: Consumer Organisations
description: Organisations that nominate a member to the Board who is knowledgeable in consumer rights and consumer affairs policy in Australia.

name: CEO of the National Health and Medical Research Council
description: This CEO nominates a member to the Board.

name: Organisations related to Science and Public Health
description: These organisations or public bodies nominate members to the Board who are qualified in fields related to public health, consumer affairs, food science, and other relevant areas.

name: Organisations related to the Food Industry
description: These organisations or public bodies nominate members to the Board who are qualified in fields related to the food industry, food processing, retailing, and other relevant areas.

name: Committee
description: Committees are established by the Board to assist in carrying out its functions or to make recommendations on applications or proposals for a high level health claims variation.

name: Members of the Board
description: Individuals who are part of the Board under the FOOD STANDARDS AUSTRALIA NEW ZEALAND ACT 1991.

name: Members of committees
description: Individuals who are part of committees under the FOOD STANDARDS AUSTRALIA NEW ZEALAND ACT 1991.

name: Remuneration Tribunal
description: The tribunal responsible for determining the remuneration of members of the Board and committees when no other determination is in force.

name: Remuneration Tribunal Act 1973
description: The act that has effect on the remuneration and allowances of members of the Board and committees under the FOOD STANDARDS AUSTRALIA NEW ZEALAND ACT 1991.

name: Member
description: A Member is an individual who can be granted leave of absence by the Chairperson under the FOOD STANDARDS AUSTRALIA NEW ZEALAND ACT 1991 - SECT 120.

name: Meeting Participation Methods
description: The Board may permit members to participate in meetings by telephone, closed-circuit television, or any other means of communication.

name: Subsection 122(5) of the Food Standards Australia New Zealand Act 1991
description: The subsection of the Act that defines the quorum for a meeting of the Board.

name: Authority's website
description: The website where the Board must publish the register of members' interests.

name: Public Governance, Performance and Accountability Act 2013 - SECT 30
description: Legislation that deals with terminating the appointment of an accountable authority, or a member of an accountable authority, for contravening general duties of officials.

name: Chief Executive Officer of the Authority
description: A position within the Authority that is appointed by the Board on a full-time basis.

name: Body Corporate involved in food production or manufacture
description: A body corporate whose primary commercial activity relates directly to the production or manufacture of food.

name: Acting Chief Executive Officer
description: A person appointed by the Board to act as the Chief Executive Officer during a vacancy or when the Chief Executive Officer is absent or unable to perform duties.

name: Acts Interpretation Act 1901
description: Legislation that includes rules applicable to acting appointments.

name: Public Service Act 1999
description: An Act that governs the engagement of staff in the public service.

name: Chief Executive Officer of the Authority
description: The Chief Executive Officer of the Food Standards Australia New Zealand Authority.

name: APS employees assisting the Chief Executive Officer
description: Australian Public Service employees who assist the Chief Executive Officer of the Authority.

name: Statutory Agency under the Public Service Act 1999
description: The Statutory Agency consisting of the Chief Executive Officer and APS employees assisting the Chief Executive Officer.

name: Consultants
description: Individuals with suitable qualifications and experience who can be engaged by the Chief Executive Officer on behalf of the Authority.

name: Secretary of a Department of the Public Service of a State or Territory
description: The Secretary of a Department of the Public Service of a State or Territory.

name: Chief Officer of a State or Territory authority
description: The Chief Officer of a State or Territory authority.

name: Chief Officer of any other authority or body
description: The Chief Officer of any other authority or body.

name: Finance Minister
description: The minister responsible for giving directions regarding the amounts and timing of money paid to the Authority.

name: Parliament
description: The legislative body responsible for appropriating money for the purposes of the Authority.

name: Section 138
description: A section of the Act that involves payment to the Authority.

name: Section 145
description: A section of the Act that involves payment to the Authority.

name: Section 147
description: A section of the Act that involves payment to the Authority.

name: Section 59 of the Public Governance, Performance and Accountability Act 2013
description: A section of another Act that allows for the investment of money not immediately required for the purposes of the Authority.

name: Commonwealth
description: The federal government of Australia

name: State
description: The individual state governments within Australia

name: Trust Money
description: Money received by the Authority from any body or person for a particular purpose consistent with the functions of the Authority.

name: Section 114 of the FOOD STANDARDS AUSTRALIA NEW ZEALAND ACT 1991
description: A section of the Act that may impose conditions on how the Authority can deal with or dispose of documents and samples that become Commonwealth property.

name: Administrative Appeals Tribunal Act 1975
description: Legislation that allows for the review of decisions, which is referenced in the context of applications for review under the FOOD STANDARDS AUSTRALIA NEW ZEALAND ACT 1991 - SECT 143.

name: Administrative Appeals Tribunal
description: The entity to which applications for review of decisions under the FOOD STANDARDS AUSTRALIA NEW ZEALAND ACT 1991 can be made.

name: decision
description: A determination made by the Authority under the FOOD STANDARDS AUSTRALIA NEW ZEALAND ACT 1991, which can be reviewed by the Administrative Appeals Tribunal.

name: person affected by the decision
description: A person whose interests are affected by a decision of a kind referred to in paragraph 143(1)(b).

name: Regulations under FOOD STANDARDS AUSTRALIA NEW ZEALAND ACT 1991
description: Regulations that may fix charges for services and facilities provided by the Authority to bodies or persons.

name: Charge for services and facilities
description: A financial obligation to be paid to the Authority for services and facilities provided, which may be paid in instalments and is recoverable as a debt.

name: New Zealand
description: A country that must not be specified as a person or body by whom charges are payable under the regulations.

name: Three Year Forward Plan of the Authority
description: A plan developed under section 20 of the Act, which must not be displaced by the consideration of an application in relation to which a charge is fixed.

name: Application to develop or vary a standard
description: A process where a charge may be fixed if it confers an exclusive capturable commercial benefit or if expedited consideration is elected by the applicant.

name: Late payment penalty rate
description: A penalty rate of 20% per year or a lower percentage if specified by the regulations.

name: Charge--discount for early payment
description: The regulations may make provision for and in relation to discounts for early payment of charge under section 146.

name: Charge under section 146
description: This is a referenced regulation related to the charge that may have discounts for early payment as per section 148.

name: Subsection 24(2)
description: A legislative provision related to the refund of charge.

name: Senior Member of the Staff of the Authority
description: A person holding a Senior Executive Service position or an APS Executive Level 2 position, or an equivalent position in the Authority.

name: Chairperson of the Board
description: The individual responsible for signing certificates stating matters with respect to a delegation of power under this section.

name: person assisting the Authority
description: A person assisting the Authority in the performance of its functions is exempt from civil or criminal proceedings, and actions or suits of any other kind in relation to loss or injury sustained because of the consumption of, or other dealing with, food.

name: Standard compliance
description: In an action related to loss or injury because of the consumption of, or other dealing with, food, compliance with a standard that has come into effect or has been adopted and published is not a defence.

name: Subsection 26(1)
description: Subsection of the Act concerning the acceptance or rejection of applications.

name: Subsection 24(1)
description: Subsection of the Act concerning the withdrawal of applications.

name: Section 109
description: Section of the Act concerning the consideration period for applications.

name: Section 95
description: Section of the Act concerning the declaration of urgent applications.

name: Section 101
description: Section of the Act concerning the 12 month period for decision making.

name: Section 33
description: Section of the Act concerning the approval of draft standards and draft variations.

name: Section 82(6)
description: Section of the Act concerning variations given to the Authority.

name: Corporate Plan
description: A plan prepared by the members of an organization.

name: Members
description: The individuals or entities responsible for preparing the corporate plan under the FOOD STANDARDS AUSTRALIA NEW ZEALAND ACT 1991.

name: Governor-General
description: The Governor-General may make regulations, not inconsistent with this Act.

name: Code of Practice
description: A set of guidelines or standards of practice that can be revoked or varied by the Authority.

name: food_standards_australia_new_zealand_act_1991_sect_10
description: The Act binds the Crown in right of the Commonwealth, of each of the States, of the Australian Capital Territory and of the Northern Territory.

name: public_notice_of_decision
description: The public notice must specify the date of effect of the Authority's decision.

name: public_notice_of_decision
description: The public notice must state how to obtain further information about the decision and the reasons for it.

name: section_68
description: Section 68 modifies the step set out in Section 61.

name: instrument
description: An instrument made under paragraph (1)(b) is not a legislative instrument.

name: section_99
description: Section 99 refers to Section 18 for the objectives of the Authority in developing food regulatory measures and variations.

name: proposal_under_section_55
description: A proposal prepared by the Authority after a review is treated as if it were a proposal under section 55.

name: food_standards_australia_new_zealand_act_1991_sect_121
description: The FOOD STANDARDS AUSTRALIA NEW ZEALAND ACT 1991 - SECT 121 references the Acts Interpretation Act 1901 for rules that apply to acting appointments.

name: food_standards_australia_new_zealand_act_1991_sect_127
description: Section 127 of the Act references Section 30 of the Public Governance, Performance and Accountability Act 2013 for additional grounds for termination.

name: food_standards_australia_new_zealand_act_1991_sect_134
description: Section 134 of the Food Standards Australia New Zealand Act 1991 refers to the Acts Interpretation Act 1901 for rules on acting appointments.

name: food_standards_australia_new_zealand_act_1991_sect_152
description: The annual report under Section 152 of the Food Standards Australia New Zealand Act 1991 is prepared under Section 46 of the Public Governance, Performance and Accountability Act 2013.

name: food_standards_australia_new_zealand_act_1991_sect_152
description: The annual report includes the number of applications made under Section 22.

name: food_standards_australia_new_zealand_act_1991_sect_152
description: The annual report includes the number of applications accepted or rejected under Subsection 26(1).

name: food_standards_australia_new_zealand_act_1991_sect_152
description: The annual report includes the number of applications withdrawn under Subsection 24(1).

name: food_standards_australia_new_zealand_act_1991_sect_152
description: The annual report includes the number of applications not assessed under Section 29.

name: food_standards_australia_new_zealand_act_1991_sect_152
description: The annual report includes occasions where the consideration period under Section 109 elapsed without completion of the procedure.

name: food_standards_australia_new_zealand_act_1991_sect_152
description: The annual report includes the number of urgent applications declared under Section 95.

name: food_standards_australia_new_zealand_act_1991_sect_152
description: The annual report includes the number of proposals prepared under Section 55.

name: food_standards_australia_new_zealand_act_1991_sect_152
description: The annual report includes the number of proposals not assessed under Section 59.

name: food_standards_australia_new_zealand_act_1991_sect_152
description: The annual report includes occasions when no decision was made within the 12 month period referred to in Subsection 101(1).

name: food_standards_australia_new_zealand_act_1991_sect_152
description: The annual report includes the number of applications with charges payable under Section 146.

name: food_standards_australia_new_zealand_act_1991_sect_152
description: The annual report includes the number of applications made to the Administrative Appeals Tribunal for review of decisions of the Authority.

name: food_standards_australia_new_zealand_act_1991_sect_152
description: The annual report includes the number of draft standards and draft variations approved under Section 33.

name: food_standards_australia_new_zealand_act_1991_sect_152
description: The annual report includes the number of variations given to the Authority under Subsection 82(6).

name: food_standards_australia_new_zealand_act_1991_sect_10
description: The Act binds the Crown in right of the Commonwealth, of each of the States, of the Australian Capital Territory and of the Northern Territory.

name: public_notice_of_decision
description: The public notice must specify the date of effect of the Authority's decision.

name: public_notice_of_decision
description: The public notice must state how to obtain further information about the decision and the reasons for it.

description: Section 68 modifies the step set out in Section 61.

name: instrument
description: An instrument made under paragraph (1)(b) is not a legislative instrument.

description: Section 99 refers to Section 18 for the objectives of the Authority in developing food regulatory measures and variations.

name: proposal_under_section_55
description: A proposal prepared by the Authority after a review is treated as if it were a proposal under section 55.

description: The annual report includes the number of applications made under Section 22.

description: The annual report includes the number of applications accepted or rejected under Subsection 26(1).

name: food_standards_australia_new_zealand_act_1991_sect_152
description: The annual report includes the number of applications withdrawn under Subsection 24(1).

name: food_standards_australia_new_zealand_act_1991_sect_152

description: The annual report includes the number of applications made to the Administrative Appeals Tribunal for review of decisions of the Authority.

name: food_standards_australia_new_zealand_act_1991_sect_152
